item.title: Report X-2024021715
item.description:
Report X-2024021715

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found at the start of the trailer on its side. It was leaking when the trailer was opened. DescribePack: The package leaked from the top of the bottle. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote and the spill was cleaned using a stabilizing powder and PPE.

item.title: Report X-2024021794
item.description:
Report X-2024021794

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a pacakge handler was unloading, he noticed that was leaking and he told to his manger. DescribePack: the pacakge was on its side and one gallon got loose cap and spilled out about 4 ounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manage called QA and QA went to the area with a red tote line with a pacakge handler and clean the area and brought the pacakge to the processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2024021559
item.description:
Report X-2024021559

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER DONNED PPE INCLUDING GLOVES, APRON, BOOTS, AND GOGGLES. THE RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE UPS DECISION TREE. CLAY BASED ABSORBENT WAS USED TO SOLIDIFY ALL SPILLED LIQUID. THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND ALL CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WERE TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA FOR DISPOSAL. ITEMS WERE DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING UPS WASTE DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report X-2024021655
item.description:
Report X-2024021655

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-17
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER PICKED UP THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATION. AFTER GOING THROUGH THE BOX, RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT ONE OF THE TWO BOTTLES WAS SHATTERED.

item.title: Report X-2024021214
item.description:
Report X-2024021214

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING OUT AND NOTIFIED THE MANAGER THE MANAGER THEN NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ALL FOUR OF THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAPS SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024030008
item.description:
Report E-2024030008

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1-gallon of UN1090 "Klean-Strip Acetone" was released from (1) 1-gallon metal pail only impacting the cardboard the product was shipped inside. The pallet was double stacked and unsecured and fell over in transit.

item.title: Report X-2024021609
item.description:
Report X-2024021609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LOADER NOTICED LEAKING PACKAGE AND CALLED RESPONDER WHO DISCOVERED PACKAGE WITH CORROSIVE AND OXIDIZER DIAMOND LABELS. SINGLE WALLED CARDBOARD BOX WITH A PLASTIC JERRICAN INSIDE. DURING CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED A SMALL AMOUNT OF KRAFT PAPER PADDED THE JERRICAN ON THREE SIDES AND THE BOTTOM OF THE JERRICAN WAS CRACKED ON THE PLASTIC SEAM.
